0$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$5/25/2014 7:19:26 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$I gained at least 35 lbs in three weeks! Find an alternative!
1$Condition: Schizophrenia$9/18/2012 2:14:32 PM$Reviewer: kaeksen
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"It has worked 100% in my case. I got back to the one i was prior to my schizophrenic start in the early 90's. Lost 18 of my years

column1: In my case i had several voices in my head
column2: either helping me
column4: or other mal adjusted types of conscious behavior. It was like my connections in my head was not connected as for memory concerned
column5: i had big trouble remembering things. Sometimes hard forming sentences (at the end before i finally gave in to drug treatment
column6: as i realized now its time to try something new.)And i dont regret it at all
column7: it was the start of a new life
column8: with the connections in my brain finally working again as they should.

column1: I would recommend others that have trouble with schizophrenia to try this drug. Dont start of with a big dose 20mg
column2: but start with 7.5mg for a week
column3: then if it doesnt work as good as wanted
column4: try 10mg for another week. For me 10mg was enough
column5: but i realize that i might in the future higher the dose. I've been on 10mg for 2 mnths now
column6: and the 10mg keeps working 95%. I sure hope that i dont have to increase the dossage very much in the future
column7: as i hope it will stablelize atleast with a 15mg dossage.

column1: Its very individual how effective the medisine is
column2: from people to people.

column1: In my case i had far too much production of dopamine
column2: and serotonine (neurotransmitters)

column1: So the meds are ""hindering"" the reseptors to use much of the D&S which i produce
column2: and it gives me calm

column1: I hope i have contributed some. Sorry 4 my bad english. Take care all. :)"

column1: 3$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$2/18/2012 7:08:38 PM$Reviewer: hotstuff
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Zydis is a kind of wonder drug for me.  I have experienced the weight gain and seemingly insatiable appetite. I don't think there are many skinny people on psychiatric drugs
column3: but that is just my personal observation. For those who don't gain
column4: wonderful!  I wish I was among that elite group.  It is a supplement to my usual dosage of Zyprexa and taken as/if needed only. Good luck to others who try it.

column1: 11$Condition: Schizophrenia$4/13/2009 10:34:03 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$3$5$Well to tell you the truth it worked for about the first few months and then afterwards the effects wore off. but i still got the sideeffects that cae with it when it stopped working. uncontrolable hunger (mostly for sweets) snd sleeping alot. over all my experience was not good but it may be different for you.
12$Condition: Other$4/9/2009 9:05:54 AM$Reviewer: Serena
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month$3$2$1$"I did not take this medication long enough to get full use of of it
column3: but when I did use it I felt very tired the next morning wanting to sleep in until at least noon even though I took it the night before. So it makes you really tired and my hunger was uncontrollable. I felt like I couldn't stop eating for some reason. My husband did notice that I seemed ""at ease"" he said that things didn't seem to bother me as much
column4: which was good for the family lol. I did feel less stressed/anxious but it wasn't worth the side effects for me."

column1: 15$Condition: Bipolar Disorder in Remission$7/27/2008 2:03:36 PM$Reviewer: timinconroe
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"I feel so much better.  When starting Zyprexa
column3: I first started sleeping like most people instead of the terrible insomnia I used to have
column5: I immediately noticed my racing mind slowing down and thinking became much more controlled.

column1: Interestingly I stopped having bruxism.  I initially gained weight
column2: but that got under control now by avoiding carbs where possible.  My mind is not racing with random or ruminating thoughts.  I still would have some depression
column4: and that was brought under control with 300 mg lithium added.  I don't feel suicidal or
column6: do foolish things associated with mania.  I now look back on my life as a manic person almost out of control and know that that won't happen anymore.

column1: Also
column2: Eli Lilly has made this drug available to me at no charge since I have little income.  How wonderful all this is!"

column1: 16$Condition: Other$7/17/2008 7:53:46 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$2$5$The efficacy of the medication has been wonderful in treating the delusions
column2: hallucinations and irrational thoughts.  I do not experience any systems with the use of this medication in combination with Risperdal in low doseage.  I have gained weight and am upset with this side effect. I sleep well at night because of the Zyprexa but the sedative nature of the medication is too strong and makes me sleep too long.
